Package data

Class DiscreteAttribute

java.lang.Object
data.Attribute
data.DiscreteAttribute
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<String>
public class DiscreteAttribute extends Attribute implements Iterable<String>
The DiscreteAttribute class represents an attribute with a set of discrete values and provides methods for getting the values, the number of distinct values, and the frequency of a specific value in a given data set. It corresponds to a discrete 'categorical' attribute. This class implement the Iterable interface
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • DiscreteAttribute

      public DiscreteAttribute(String name, int index, String[] values)
      The constructor for the 'DiscreteAttribute' class. It is used to create a new instance of the 'DiscreteAttribute' class with the specified name, index, and set of discrete values.
      Parameters:
      name - as a string representing the name of the attribute
      index - as an integer representing the identifier of the tuple
      values - initializes a 'TreeSet' object named `values` and adds each string value from the input array to the 'values' set.

  • Method Details

    • getValues

      public TreeSet<String> getValues()
      The function returns a TreeSet of Strings that correspond to the values of the attribute.
      Returns:
      a 'TreeSet' of 'String' objects named 'values' is being returned.

    • getNumberOfDistinctValues

      public int getNumberOfDistinctValues()
      This function returns the number of distinct values in a collection.
      Returns:
      the size of the 'values' collection.

    • frequency

      public int frequency(Data data, Set<Integer> idList, String v)
      This Java function calculates the frequency (number of ocurrences) of a given string value in a set of integers based on a specific attribute in a Data list of examples.
      Parameters:
      data - The data object contains information about the examples, such as the attributes and their values for each instance.
      idList - A set of integers representing the IDs of the data instances to be searched for a specific attribute value.
      v - is a String variable representing the attribute value that we want to count the frequency of in the given set of ids.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value which represents the number of occurences of a given string value 'v' in a set of data identified by a set of integer IDs 'idList'.

    • iterator

      public Iterator<String> iterator()
      This function returns an iterator for a collection of String values.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<String>
      Returns:
      An iterator over a collection of strings is being returned.
